subject: Re: [junit] Need to test a method that returns void
msgSnippet: Or something like this: public void testDoSomething() throws ExpectedExceptioinType { expectThatExceptionThrown(is.instanceOf(ExpectedExceptionType.class));
messageBody:
Or something like this:

public void testDoSomething() throws ExpectedExceptioinType {
expectThatExceptionThrown(is.instanceOf(ExpectedExceptionType.class));
foo.doSomething();
}



On 5/9/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> Tiago Fernandez wrote:
> > Hello Venkat,
> >
> > Are you using JUnit 4? If so, take a look at
> > http://www.instrumentalservices.com/content/view/45/52/#_Expecting_exceptions
> >
> > Otherwise you should do something like:
> >
> > try {
> > foo.doSomething();
> > fail("Exception should be raised!");
> > }
> > catch (Exception ex) {
> > // passed :-)
> > }
>
> Have you tried this?
>
> try {
> foo.doSomething();
> fail("Exception should be raised!");
> }
> catch (Exception passed) {}
>
> I admit, it removes the :-), which is cute, but it's duplicated in so
> many tests!
